text.head: 2. Cable Model
2.1. Distributed Parameters of Tunnel-Installed Cables
text.p:
The three-phase cable can be regarded as a transmission line system consisting of 6 conductors. The propagation characteristics of the voltage and current on the conductors are determined by the distributed impedance matrix Z (unit: Ω) and the distributed admittance matrix Y (unit: S). The skin effect in the metal sheath is enhanced at high frequencies and the current is bound to the inner surface and outer surface of the sheath, which makes the transfer impedance decrease rapidly and it can be ignored. The formulas to calculate the impedance and admittance of directly buried cables have been given in. The calculation of the admittance of tunnel-installed cables is the same, but the self-impedance zs and mutual impedance zm used to obtain the impedances zcc, zss zss, and zmu need to be calculated by Tylavsky’s high-frequency formulas.
